teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Green Oranges Book Club
teams.loan_because: it's what we do!
teams.description:
This team grew out of the Supporting Younger Borrowers team and is a place for us to meet to talk about books, particularly books that help us better to understand the borrowers and countries to whom we lend.

UP NEXT: The House of Spirits by Isabel Allende

The following are the books that have already been read by the group – due to the free-spirited natures of the members of this group combined with their unending ability to be sidetracked by other books and side discussions along the way, there has not been set times for reading/discussing books. 

(9) Small Island, by Andrea Levy (Jamaica)
(8) The International Bank of Bob by Bob Harris (worldwide)
(7) The House of the Mosque by Kader Abdolah (Iran)
(6) The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency by Alexander McCall Smith (Botswana)
(5) Half the Sky by Nicholas Kristoff & Sheryl WuDunn (worldwide)
(4) King Peggy by Peggielene Bartels & Eleanor Herman (Ghana)
(3) The Beauty of Humanity Movement by Camilla Gibb (Vietnam)
(2) Banker to the Poor by Muhammad Yunus (Bangladesh)
(1) Green Oranges on Lion Mountain by Emily Joy (Sierra Leone)

Suggested Books:

I Shall Not Hate: A Gaza Doctor's Journey by Izzeldin Abuelaish (Palestinian territories)
Cutting for Stone by Abraham Verghese (India)
The Hospital by the River  by Dr. Catherine Hamlin (Ethiopia)

Sweetness in the Belly by Camilla Gibb (Ethiopia)
Replenishing the Earth by Wangari Matthai (Kenya)
Little Princes  by Conor Grennan (Nepal)
Three Cups of Tea by Greg Mortensen and David Renin (Pakistan)
Three Cups of Deceit by Jon Krakauer (Pakistan)
Damned Nations by Dr. Samantha Nutt (worldwide)
Mighty Be Our Powers by Leymah Gbowee (Liberia)
What Is the What: The Autobiography of Valentino Achak Deng  by Dave Eggars (Sudan)
The Road of Lost Innocence by Somaly Mam (Cambodia)
The Bite of the Mango by Mariatu Kamara (Sierra Leone)
The Rugmaker of Maza-e-Sharif by Najaf Mazari (Afghanistan)
The Lady Cyclist's Guide to Kashgar by Suzanne Joinson (China)
The Hundred Year Old Man who Climbed Out of the Window and Disappeared by Jonas Jonasson (worldwide)

teams.name: CRAN Lending is Caring
teams.whereabouts: Cape Coast, Ghana and the world!
teams.loan_because: we care.
teams.description: We are a group of Christian Rural Aid Network staff members, Kiva Fellows, friends, and supporters from all over the world that are committed to improving the lives of the poor in Ghana through microlending.

teams.name: JV Mine
teams.loan_because: Caring Ghana
teams.description: www.jvmine.com

teams.name: Clareo Partners
teams.loan_because:
Kiva is a perfect fit. Clareo Partners is a consulting firm focusing on innovation and we think that Kiva’s peer-to-peer model for lending is one of the most powerful innovations to raise people out of poverty around the world.  Kiva answers the desperate need for credit amongst the poorest of the poor. We understand how important small businesses are to any economy and how market forces can be used to permanently keep people out of poverty in a way that charity cannot. 

We also understand how important it is to provide general operating support, so we have made an additional $1,000 donation to Kiva to keep the lights on :)
teams.description: Our team is made up of the amazing men and women who work for Clareo Partners, our clients and additional friends. From providing small business consulting in Kyrgyzstan to helping one of our clients roll out a micro-franchise initiative in Ghana, Clareo knows that empowering small, local businesses is one of the best routes to sustainable prosperity for all people.

teams.description: We are a global group of female entrepreneurs transforming our lives - and the lives of others - by building our own successful businesses.

teams.name: Matthew Christopher Memorial Team

teams.name: Grameen-Jameel
teams.loan_because:
we believe lending to Entrepreneurs is a powerful catalyst for positive change.

The power to start making a change is in our hands . . . one loan at a time.
teams.description:
Grameen Jameel was established as a company in 2003 and incorporated in 2007 as a joint venture between Grameen Foundation and Abdul Latif Jameel Community Initiatives.

The company’s mission is to help alleviate poverty by providing financial and technical assistance to microfinance institutions in the Middle East, North Africa and Turkey Region (MENA&T).

The company’s mission is to help alleviate poverty by providing financial and technical assistance to microfinance institutions in the Middle East, North Africa and Turkey Region (MENA&T).

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***

http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: The Capital Group
teams.loan_because: Capital Group is committed to making a positive impact on our global communities.  Our associates care about making the world a better place, and the power of micro-lending can support entrepreneurship and positive social change.  Access to capital is foundational to start or grow businesses, create jobs, alleviate poverty, empower women and families, and create sustainable opportunities.  Every dollar loaned on Kiva goes directly to funding loans, and once repaid, can be re-invested over and over again.
teams.description: Capital Group and our associates, personally support more than 2,000 nonprofit organizations around the world.  We are leveraging the global network of Kiva, and striving to make meaningful loans to entrepreneurs across 83 countries.

we believe lending to Entrepreneurs is a powerful catalyst for positive change.

teams.description:
Grameen Jameel was established as a company in 2003 and incorporated in 2007 as a joint venture between Grameen Foundation and Abdul Latif Jameel Community Initiatives.

The company’s mission is to help alleviate poverty by providing financial and technical assistance to microfinance institutions in the Middle East, North Africa and Turkey Region (MENA&T).

teams.name: Poland

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: FIRST Team 1086 Blue Cheese Robotics Team
teams.whereabouts: Deep Run High School, Glen Allen, VA
teams.loan_because: Blue Cheese endeavors to "Spread the GOUDA news" about FIRST programs and the importance of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM).
teams.description: Blue Cheese is a team which builds robots to compete in the FIRST Robotics Competition each year and spreads enthusiasm for Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math throughout the world.

teams.name: The Capital Group
teams.loan_because: Capital Group is committed to making a positive impact on our global communities.  Our associates care about making the world a better place, and the power of micro-lending can support entrepreneurship and positive social change.  Access to capital is foundational to start or grow businesses, create jobs, alleviate poverty, empower women and families, and create sustainable opportunities.  Every dollar loaned on Kiva goes directly to funding loans, and once repaid, can be re-invested over and over again.
teams.description: Capital Group and our associates, personally support more than 2,000 nonprofit organizations around the world.  We are leveraging the global network of Kiva, and striving to make meaningful loans to entrepreneurs across 83 countries.

teams.name: 7 Degrees of Good Karma
teams.loan_because: We believe in paying it forward.
teams.description: We're a group of friends and family who want to see how 7 degrees of separation can grow our tiny team into a sea of connected friends who can really make a difference in the lives of others through KIVA.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

a delightfully diverse group of Austinites. Be proud, Team Austin--our Kiva team is second only to NYC (with nearly 4X as many members!) for total lending for a city team. 
And a hearty WELCOME!! to all our new members.

teams.name: Cheese Fanciers
teams.whereabouts: Everywhere a good cheese is enjoyed.
teams.loan_because: there is nothing like a good cheese, and we support those who make and sell cheeses and related dairy products around the world.
teams.description: I've often searched for a team to which I could credit my cheese-related loans, and finally realized it was time to create one. Let's support cheesemongers and cheesemakers worldwide whose passion matches our own.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

teams.name: Themeco
teams.description: We love the internet, but we love people more! New to Kiva? Join our free trial campaign and make your first loan on us: http://kiva.org/themeco Let's make a difference together. All are welcome to join our team!

teams.name: Grameen-Jameel
teams.loan_because:
we believe lending to Entrepreneurs is a powerful catalyst for positive change.

The power to start making a change is in our hands . . . one loan at a time.
teams.description:
Grameen Jameel was established as a company in 2003 and incorporated in 2007 as a joint venture between Grameen Foundation and Abdul Latif Jameel Community Initiatives.

The company’s mission is to help alleviate poverty by providing financial and technical assistance to microfinance institutions in the Middle East, North Africa and Turkey Region (MENA&T).

teams.name: Team Herrmann
teams.loan_because:
A little can mean a lot.
I may not be able to change the whole world but I can change one person's world one at a time. 


The Boy and the Starfish

A man was walking along a deserted beach at sunset. As he walked he could see a young boy in the distance, as he drew nearer he noticed that the boy kept bending down, picking something up and throwing it into the water.
 Time and again he kept hurling things into the ocean. 

As the man approached even closer, he was able to see that the boy was picking up starfish that had been washed up on the beach and, one at a time he was throwing them back into the water. 

The man asked the boy what he was doing, the boy replied,"I am throwing these washed up starfish back into the ocean, or else they will die. "But", said the man, "You can't possibly save them all, there are thousands on this beach, and this must be happening on hundreds of beaches along the coast. You can't possibly make a difference."
 The boy looked down, frowning for a moment; then bent down to pick up another starfish, smiling as he threw it back into the sea. He replied, 

"I made a huge difference to that one!"  


~Author Unknown~

teams.name: DeutscheBank
teams.loan_because:
Each of us has the ability to help address poverty in a meaningful way and collectively we can positively impact social change.

Deutsche Bank has partnered with Kiva to provide US employees the opportunity to make loans to entrepreneurs of their choice. This capital will help borrowers improve their own lives and create sustainable income to support their families and their communities.

With full participation from our franchise, employees have the potential to impact more than 500,000 people in the developing world.
teams.description: For more than 20 years, Deutsche Bank has been a leader and trusted partner in the field of social finance. Leveraging its core capabilities as a global financial services firm, the Bank has financed opportunities to serve the poor ranging from affordable housing and microfinance to clean energy and healthcare. This collective work represents more than USD 2.5 billion in capital deployed. Deutsche Bank’s Global Social Investments group has relationships with over 120 microfinance institutions (MFIs) in 50 countries around the world. The Bank is committed to complying with laws prohibiting discrimination in lending.

teams.name: The Capital Group
teams.loan_because: Capital Group is committed to making a positive impact on our global communities.  Our associates care about making the world a better place, and the power of micro-lending can support entrepreneurship and positive social change.  Access to capital is foundational to start or grow businesses, create jobs, alleviate poverty, empower women and families, and create sustainable opportunities.  Every dollar loaned on Kiva goes directly to funding loans, and once repaid, can be re-invested over and over again.
teams.description: Capital Group and our associates, personally support more than 2,000 nonprofit organizations around the world.  We are leveraging the global network of Kiva, and striving to make meaningful loans to entrepreneurs across 83 countries.

teams.name: Lufthansa
teams.loan_because: Every day we help 209.500 people all over the world to reach their goals. So we just do what we know how to do best lending people a hand to reach their goal.
teams.description: Deutsche Lufthansa AG is a global aviation group. The Group operates in five business segments, each dedicated to high quality standards. The five units – the passenger airline business, logistics, MRO, catering and IT services – all play a leading role in the industry in which they operate. The Lufthansa Group includes a total of more than 400 subsidiaries and associated companies. Foremost at Lufthansa are such attributes as quality and innovation, safety and reliability. We are well positioned strategically, operationally and financially to negotiate ups-and-downs in the economy. Our corporate strategy is geared to sustainable value creation and is expressed in our commitment to shareholder value. We attach priority to profitability over size.

This is OUR CHANCE to GIVE OUR COUNTRYMEN A CHANCE!!!

To find a Filipino entrepreneurs, click on the LEND button and just type in "Philippines" in the search field. There are always a few new entrepreneurs on a daily basis. But if you don't see one on that day. Try again the following day.

Lend - NOW!!!!

teams.name: milepoint
teams.loan_because: As travelers we have seen poverty first hand and are committed to making the world a better place for all.
teams.description: Travelers who collect miles and points and seek free flights, hotel rooms and upgrades where possible. Here we seek to give back and invite everyone to join with us and make a difference.

teams.name: Guys holding fish
teams.loan_because: We feel an affinity for entrepreneurs that make their living by fishing, selling fish, or attempting to make their lives better because of their proximity to the ocean, or freshwater locales...
teams.description:
We love fish and/or fishing so much that many of us have chosen to present ourselves on KIVA with a photo of ourselves, holding a fish!  We welcome "gals" to join, as well, the name of the team notwithstanding...  

We certainly support "sustainable" fishing, but also recognize that sometimes, our "Western" views of resource management may not match the needs of the very desperate folks, in other countries, struggling to make a living, or even providing food for their families ...  Our intent is to help the struggling, without regard to their profession or trade.  We believe that our lending record well represents that goal, as we are a pretty diverse group, with very diverse lending interests....

teams.name: Stanford Executive Program (SEP) Alumni
teams.loan_because: We are committed to meaningful entrepreneurship and making a difference

teams.name: The Capital Group
teams.loan_because: Capital Group is committed to making a positive impact on our global communities.  Our associates care about making the world a better place, and the power of micro-lending can support entrepreneurship and positive social change.  Access to capital is foundational to start or grow businesses, create jobs, alleviate poverty, empower women and families, and create sustainable opportunities.  Every dollar loaned on Kiva goes directly to funding loans, and once repaid, can be re-invested over and over again.
teams.description: Capital Group and our associates, personally support more than 2,000 nonprofit organizations around the world.  We are leveraging the global network of Kiva, and striving to make meaningful loans to entrepreneurs across 83 countries.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Pilipinas
teams.loan_because:
We CAN help our kababayans be financially independent.

Let us provide the nets so they can fish.
teams.description:
This is OUR CHANCE to GIVE OUR COUNTRYMEN A CHANCE!!!

Your $25 will go a long, long way to create livelihood opportunities for our kababayans. Let us help them help themselves. Let us empower them to help lift themselves out of poverty.  And ... YOU GET YOUR MONEY BACK because they will pay you back!

To find a Filipino entrepreneurs, click on the LEND button and just type in "Philippines" in the search field. There are always a few new entrepreneurs on a daily basis. But if you don't see one on that day. Try again the following day.

Lend - NOW!!!!

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: DeutscheBank
teams.loan_because:
Each of us has the ability to help address poverty in a meaningful way and collectively we can positively impact social change.

Deutsche Bank has partnered with Kiva to provide US employees the opportunity to make loans to entrepreneurs of their choice. This capital will help borrowers improve their own lives and create sustainable income to support their families and their communities.

With full participation from our franchise, employees have the potential to impact more than 500,000 people in the developing world.
teams.description: For more than 20 years, Deutsche Bank has been a leader and trusted partner in the field of social finance. Leveraging its core capabilities as a global financial services firm, the Bank has financed opportunities to serve the poor ranging from affordable housing and microfinance to clean energy and healthcare. This collective work represents more than USD 2.5 billion in capital deployed. Deutsche Bank’s Global Social Investments group has relationships with over 120 microfinance institutions (MFIs) in 50 countries around the world. The Bank is committed to complying with laws prohibiting discrimination in lending.

teams.name: Incentro
teams.loan_because: Incentro wants to stimulate entrepreneurship in order to make poorer parts of the world more prosperous. At the same time, Incentro does not believe in dependence. Incentro’s international focus is therefore on providing microcredit to entrepreneurs in developing countries.
teams.description: Incentro is a specialist firm that believes in inspiring people through information. We foster an inspiring environment, where people are encouraged to join the Incentro lending team.

teams.name: Australia

Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds
